View Javadoc

1   package org.openimaj.demos.sandbox.tldcpp.detector;
2   
3   import java.util.ArrayList;
4   import java.util.List;
5   
6   import org.openimaj.math.geometry.shape.Rectangle;
7   
8   /**
9    * This state class holds the results of {@link DetectorCascade#detect(org.openimaj.image.FImage)} and
10   * is used primarily to save having to do this work again, this can probably be protected or gone entirley 
11   * @author Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
12   *
13   */
14  public class DetectionResult {
15  
16  	/**
17  	 * Whether the contained results are valid
18  	 */
19  	public boolean containsValidData;
20  //	public List<Rectangle> fgList;
21  	/**
22  	 * The probability of each window as set by the {@link EnsembleClassifier}
23  	 */
24  	public float [] posteriors; /* Contains the posteriors for each slding window. Is of size numWindows. Allocated by tldInitClassifier. */
25  	/**
26  	 * The windows which we are confident (by the 3 classifiers) might contain the object
27  	 */
28  	public List<Integer> confidentIndices;
29  	/**
30  	 * This is a numberOfTrees * numberOfWindows list containing the feature for each tree for each window
31  	 */
32  	public int [] featureVectors;
33  	/**
34  	 * This is a numberOfWindows list containing the variance of each window
35  	 */
36  	public float [] variances;
37  	/**
38  	 * The number of clusters which confident windows were grouped into based on their overlaps
39  	 */
40  	public int numClusters;
41  	/**
42  	 * The current window estimated by the detector (afte clustering)
43  	 */
44  	public Rectangle detectorBB;
45  	/**
46  	 * The number of windows skipped thanks to variance check
47  	 */
48  	public int varCount;
49  	/**
50  	 * The number of windows skipped thanks to ensemble classifier
51  	 */
52  	public int ensCount;
53  	/**
54  	 * The number of windows skipped thanks to normalised correlation.
55  	 */
56  	public int nnClassCount;
57  
58  	DetectionResult() {
59  		containsValidData = false;
60  		confidentIndices = new ArrayList<Integer>();
61  		numClusters = 0;
62  		detectorBB = null;
63  
64  		variances = null;
65  		posteriors = null;
66  		featureVectors = null;
67  	}
68  
69  
70  	void init(int numWindows, int numTrees) {
71  		variances = new float[numWindows];
72  		posteriors = new float[numWindows];
73  		featureVectors = new int[numWindows*numTrees];
74  		confidentIndices = new ArrayList<Integer>();
75  
76  	}
77  
78  	void reset() {
79  		containsValidData = false;
80  		if(confidentIndices != null) confidentIndices.clear();
81  		numClusters = 0;
82  		detectorBB = null;
83  		varCount = 0;
84  		ensCount = 0;
85  		nnClassCount = 0;
86  	}
87  
88  	void release() {
89  		variances = null;
90  		posteriors = null;
91  		featureVectors = null;
92  		confidentIndices = null;
93  		detectorBB = null;
94  		containsValidData = false;
95  	}
96  
97  
98  }
